newsitem.title: AUSTRALIA: Westfield Trust in A$147 mln asset swap.
newsitem.headline: Westfield Trust in A$147 mln asset swap.

text.p: Westfield Trust said on Tuesday it would buy the remaining 50 percent interest in Melbourne's Doncaster Shoppingtown from National Mutual Holdings Ltd for A$147 million at a yield of 7.5 percent.
"Simultaneously, Westfield Trust will sell its 50 percent interest in West Lakes Shoppingtown in Adelaide to National Mutual for $68 million at a yield of 8.25 percent," Westfield said.
"Westfield Trust will fund the A$79 million due to National Mutual by additional borrowings," it said.
"The property 'swap', which meets the needs of both parties, will result in Westfield Trust owning 100 percent of Doncaster while National Mutual will own 100 percent of West Lakes."

The transaction would allow Westfield Trust to concentrate its Adelaide activity to its two major centres there in the Marion and the Tea Tree Plaza, Westfield Trust executive director Stephen Lowy said in a statement.
Westfield Trust is managed by Westfield Holdings Ltd.

National Mutual Funds Management chief executive Sam Kavourakis said in the same statement the decision to sell its Doncaster holding represented a reweighting of National Mutual's investment in retail property in its number two statutory fund.
